Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, location is fantastic and the rooms are funky and fun. Bar and restaurant are great. Staff is wonderful. Check out the roof deck... the view is wonderful at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vitale is the perfect "get away to the city" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scfamily95062
Reviews.Content: The staff (from valet parking and front desk- to room service) were professional, knowledgeable and kind. The hotel was filled with room and rooftop water front views of the Embarcadero. The smell of fresh spa herbs filled the hallways and our modern room was gorgeously green and very clean. The room service was also excellent-great eggs bene. Wonderful trip! We would definitely stay at the Vitale again. Santa Cruz, CA.

Reviews.Title: “in place to be seen”
Reviews.Author: missymlincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday tea time, sun shining and bar packed to the rafters. Hotel was spotless and perfectly located but did pay more than at any other previously visited US hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: iwtt
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and were pleased with the value. Unfortunately, we ran out of hot water in the morning, but the front desk made note of it. Overall, we had a good experience. With regard to the physical aspects, the most impressive feature was the exceptionally fine linens - the kind the ordinary consumer is hard pressed to find. We also loved the wide window seat where we could unpack our bags for easy access. The entry to the room is conveniently wide, due to the bathroom having a pocket (sliding) door rather than a swinging door. We liked the soothing décor with its teak furniture and textured wall covering. The lighting was good, and the bathroom mirrors remained clear of steam build-up, due to efficient, quiet ventilation. Our inner room had no view, but we did not care because we enjoyed the spectacular view from the terrace instead. The reception desk had efficient service and all the staff we met in the hallways, as well as those who were setting up for a special event on one of the terraces, were very friendly and welcoming. There is a complimentary yoga class at 9am. The instructor did not show up Sunday morning, but while the manager was checking her whereabouts, we four who had gathered in the large carpeted room spent a pleasant hour of informal yoga stretching on the provided mats. One of the young women raved about the wonderful “bathing ritual” she and her husband had experienced at Spa Vitale’s rooftop garden the evening before. Her description was enough to tempt us to return!

Reviews.Title: “Central location for all attractions - excellent concierge Kevin”
Reviews.Author: Jaz3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and found a very smart and comfortable hotel. Complimentary water, local chocolate and next day weather chart with evening bed turndown. Service excellent and Kevin the concierge recommended a route on our trip to Napa Valley, including a hotel with a ittle known cafe to the side of the main restaurant with stunning views and fab lunch. Thanks. Very well placed hotel for Pier 39 - not too close but could walk or take tram. Hotel used a lot for business and the bar in the evening was noisy and full, but we were not disturbed in our room and were out sightseeing most of the time. Loved San Francisco and Vitale

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views, service, and attentiont to detail!”
Reviews.Author: scsf33
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in San Francisco but this one stands apart from the rest. Its location allows for easy access to all the tourist destinations as well as a peaceful night of sleep. The rooms are impeccably decorated, with attention given to lighting, color, and cleanliness. The terrace offers privacy and amazing views of the Port and Farmer's Market. Breakfast out on the terrace makes for a wonderful start to the day! The staff is helpful and available.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: csmears
Reviews.Content: Everytime i'm in SF, I try to stay at the Vitale. Great little hotel with a wonderful bar. Pros: Great rooms, clean and modern. Location is near the Ferry Building. Lots of great restaurants close by. Bar is a hot spot for happy hour. Good value Cons: Service is just OK. That being said, I've never really needed anything. The rooms and facilities are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: petalee
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect but the thing that made our stay extra special was the staff. Nothing was too much trouble, friendly and helpful. Shopping and restaurant suggestions from staff were spot on. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LOLAMiami10
Reviews.Content: Visited San Francisco on March 12, 2010 with my husband, the trip was unforgettable, including our stay at Hotel Vitale. The check in staff was very kind and friendly. The Americano Restaurant has fantastic food and they even have happy hours. Great city location. Hotel Vitale is at walking distance to the Metro and bus stations. I needed directions to get to a specific place from the Hotel and was given immediate attention from their staff and they even provided me with a computer printout. The standard room was spacious and a beautiful view to the Bay Bridge. I really do recommend Hotel Vitale in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDIreland79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2009 for 4 nights....we'd just arrived in San Francisco for the first part of a holiday on the West Coast and the Vitale definitely got things off to a good start. We had a great view of the Bay Bridge from our room and the room itself was very comfortable, spacious and clean. The staff at reception and in the restaurant were friendly and helpful throughout and the concierge was extremely keen to help us out with any questions we had. In terms of location, the Vitale is just across from the Ferry Building and we had one of the best meals ever at the Slanted Door restaurant, which is at one corner of that building. It's a nice 10 minute walk from the hotel to Union Square; although the hotel is officially in the financial district, we found the location perfect for what was a holiday and not a business trip....in fact it's a good location (beside the water) in terms of discovering the many piers and getting to know the layout of the city. Overall, this is a great hotel (in a great city!) and i'd highly recommend it. The excellent service makes it all the better. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kirsantacruz
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely weekend at the Vitale for a girls getaway. We went to the Ferry Building across the street for the beautiful farmers market. Great view from our room. Next time I'll be back for a Giants game! Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous SF stay!”
Reviews.Author: BabaP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Vitale while visiting SF and had a GREAT end-to-end experience. Very comfortable, hip and clean room. Nice view of the bay and ferry building area. The staff (housekeeping and doormen in particular) made us feel very welcome and important. Close proximity to the embarcadero, the ferry building and dozens of restaurants made it very convenient. We will come again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a tired business traveler”
Reviews.Author: jooles_p
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Vitale. At check in, the staff was friendly and efficient. They set the tone for my stay. Although i came to San Francisco for a business trip, the hotel's location made it easy for me to meet up with college friends. I never sleep well on business trips but the cozy and comfortable bed made it easy for me to get much needed rest. The workspace and free internet service helped me to get work done quickly. Room service was tasty and arrived hot. My only wish is that i could have slept in and also enjoyed the yoga classes, fitness room and spa -- and spent a little more time checking out the neighborhood. But I'm hoping to return next month for a weekend with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, horrible and hideous”
Reviews.Author: jimprnz19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a decent location for downtown, but way away from any tourist attractions. The concierge service has no idea about the town and charge you for asking them questions. There are also hidden taxes and fees that the hotel will not explain but will gladly tack on to your bill upon check out. Don't call any part of the hotel other than the front desk from the in room phone or they will charge you. The rooms get hot at night and they only go down to 65. The walls are thin and the restaurant is loud. The only positive thing about the place is the spa and that is if you don't mind creepy people touching you. The rooms are over crowded with furniture and they don't have water or an ice machine. The minifridge is outrageously priced and dont dare take out their items and insert your own during your stay cause once the cleaning service has seen them you will be charged. The hotel also placed a hold on one of our credit cards and after 5 days still refuse to release the funds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice!”
Reviews.Author: benjaminf
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my wife and our 5 month old baby over President's Day / Valentines Day weekend and couldn't have been more happy with our stay. We had a King room facing the Embarcadero / Bay / Ferry Building and the views out the windows were captivating. Especially being with our baby and not being able to get out and walk around the City as much as we used to it was very nice to be in the room and still feel part of the City by people watching out the windows and seeing the boats and barges come and go in the Bay. I had never really spent much time in this area of the City before but was impressed, much better than Union Square. We had nice walks along the Embarcadero, and ate great food from the market shop across the street at the Ferry Building. We ordered room service for some 'snacks' later in the evening and the service was prompt and food was fresh. Prices were reasonable from the restaurant downstairs and afterwards we wished we had ordered full dinner in. Every employee was very friendly and welcoming, everyone seemed to genuinely make us feel comfortable. And despite being a very busy weekend at the hotel we didn't run into any problems. We managed to have a very memorable weekend both romantic and fun (with our baby), we certainly want to go back for another stay. One tip if you are driving your own car would be to park in one of the public garages nearby, we paid $29 for a 24 hour period where the hotel valet services is $45. Plus you won't have to feel out of place if stuck behind a Maserati in the porte cochere que!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lpqmember
Reviews.Content: we just returned from our stay at Hotel Vitale. It was our second stay in a circular suite and it was perfect from beginning to end. Too bad it had to end. No noise complaints as we were on a high floor. Service was prompt, housekeeping was efficient and the little creature comforts like an environmental sounds machine, cd and dvd players, drop dead wrap around bay views with retractable blinds make this room type unique. We love the comfort and the shower is fantastic. Keith, the chef concierge is top notch--obviously one of the best anywhere and we are frequent travelers to 4 and 5 star hotels. The other concierges were helpful and knowledgable too. The Embarcadero location is terrific for walking, across the street from the Ferry Bldg. (yum) and close to great restaurants and shopping for tourists. BART and the Bay Bridge are right there, and I can't think of a better location to stay if you enjoy boutique hotels with style and substance. I lived in San Francisco, and there's no hotels in the Marina or Pacific Heights in this category. In fact there are really no good hotels in either neighborhood. SF is a compact city and easy to get around. But the proximity to everywhere you want to go is the best from the Embarcadero if you enjoy exploring the city, connecting to buses or bart and even exploring Mission Bay and the housing development there. Take the Filbert Street Steps for a hidden surprise, relax and listen to the waterfall fountain at Levi's Plaza's hidden little park, take a ferry ride to Marin or the East Bay.......

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jsw900
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Vitale during our first trip to San Francisco and could not have asked for a better location or hotel. Staff was very attentive and definitely contributed to a great stay. Rooms offer incredible views of the Bay Bridge! Also, got an excellent tip from the concierge that Restaurant Gary Danko accepts walk-ins to dine in the bar area. Would have missed out on dining in this fabulous restaurant had it not been for that. Will definitely go back to this hotel during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location for a San Francisco visit.”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityPianist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during the second week of December. On arrival, the staff was friendly and professional; it remained so throughout our visit. Although we did not require extensive assistance from the concierge, he provided us very accurate and helpful information on getting around in the city. The hotel is in an ideal location for using San Francisco's excellent public transportation. In fact, one can get from the airport to the hotel (and back) very easily by using the BART and getting off at the Embarcadero Station. The price for this trip is merely $8.10 per person. The walk to the hotel from the BART station takes a little over 5 minutes. Across the street from the hotel is the Ferry Market Building which is a major hub for public transportation to all points in the city. You can buy a pass and get unlimited rides for $6.00 a day. (The passes are sold in the Ferry Market Building.) The hotel bills itself as a "spa" hotel and offers various services on its top floor. The prices are what one would expect for the same services in any major metropolitan area. We had reserved a slightly more expensive room with an "ocean view" and were not disappointed. The room was large enough to move to accommodate us, our luggage, and could have slept 2 more people on a sleeper sofa in the room. The bathroom was large but did not have a tub. Instead, it had a "rain shower" that was comfortable and efficient. At night, we initially had some concerns about the music playing downstairs, but all was quiet by around 10:00 p.m. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel is certainly not stingy about supplying pillows! The restaurant is a tad expensive. We did, however have breakfast there twice and, although there are cheaper places to eat, we must admit that the food was very good. Try the eggs scrambled with truffles - they are delicious. There is a small business center on the second floor of the hotel that has three computers with free internet access for guests. Very handy for checking email, reservations, etc. if you do not want to drag a laptop with you on your trip. The exterior of the hotel is not glamorous - but it is very functional and the staff at the front door very friendly and helpful. Obviously, this hotel cannot compete with the big guys in town as a major convention center, but it appears to work remarkably well for smaller business group meetings and seems to do a brisk business with business travelers. All in all, this was a pleasant surprise and a nice departure from "industrial hotels" such as the Hyatt and the Hilton. What I truly appreciate about this hotel is that it does not pretend to be anything but a pleasant and convenient place to live, relax, and perhaps get refreshed with its spa facilities while on a short visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Decent Location, Beware the Noise”
Reviews.Author: JSNYCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel last week while on business. It is fairly new, well-maintained, fairly well-situated with beautiful views of the Bay Bridge (although I think Pac Heights or the Marina is a much better location for tourists), and has an earthy California quality to it (think pebbles, soothing colors, and spa CD's). All in, it was fine, but the noise (as others have pointed out) can be an issue. Upon check-in, I asked for a quiet room. They informed me they would do the best the could, but the hotel was sold out and were limited in what they could do. Fair enough. They ended up putting me on a low floor on the Mission Street side (not the noisy Embarcadero) and close to the elevator. Not ideal, but it was the best they could do. The problem simply is that it's noisy wherever you are. Even with double-paned windows on the side street (if you want to call Mission a side street), it's noisy. If I were there for pleasure, it would've been more of an issue. Unless you're up early for business (as I was), you might want to think twice. Otherwise, it'll do the job just fine.

Reviews.Title: “great comfortable hotel right in front of the farmers market”
Reviews.Author: skyybluebunny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for both business and leisure. Great comfortable rooms and a fun bar. I love the lavender smell in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vitale”
Reviews.Author: ScottishRobbie
Reviews.Content: Spent a fabulous week in SF staying at the Hotel Vitale. Welcomed at reception with a hot towel after a long haul flight was much appreciated. Our room was a deluxe waterfront on the sixth floor which we thoroughly recommend. Great views of the Embarcadero and out to the Bay Bridge. Easy connections into the centre using the historic F line streetcars or just a short walk to the underground. Hotel and room were spotless, big comfy bed, great bathroom and very friendly staff. Must mention and thank Keith (Concierge) for all his help.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: FreshSugar
Reviews.Content: Rooms: *Clean, Modern and bright! *The bed was super comfy with lots of plush pillows + nice "crate&barrel-ish" bed sheets * Room service was fantastic: ordered a midnight snack of fresh baked cookies and ice cream with ice cold milk. The service was friendly and timely. * FOR ONCE, I wanted to eat and drink everything in the fridge + snack cabinet in a hotel (it's amazing!) * For the first time, I actually LIKED the toiletries a hotel carried.. they happened to carry my favorite brand: Fresh, which is originally from San Francisco. The Sugar Lemon Bath Gel smelled delicious. Location: * walkable distance to everywhere we wanted to go. it is close to Pier 1. Service: *Check in: Friendly, Easy and fast. I also asked for an early check-in due to a last minute flight change, they were more than happy to accommodate. * Check out: Friendly, easy and fast. We had to check out very early (around 6am). Value: * We booked through Expedia during the peak Spring Break season. We still got a great deal, and this hotel was worth every $$ . never encountered a single problem and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good thing the location rocks”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastmidge
Reviews.Content: Was hoping for great, but got just good at the Vitale. The room was clean, but the bathroom was just kinda average. Our request upon check-in for a morning paper went unfulfilled four days out of five and on our first day, housekeeping forgot our room and we had to go hang out for half an hour while they did their thing (at 4:00 in the afternoon.) However, the location is fantastic; great view of the Bay Bridge, and spitting distance to the Ferry Building that has a food market, restaurants of all sorts, and of course amazing views. If you stay here, try to get rooms on floor four or above for a good water view. Not sure what the city-side rooms are like. Another plus is the free access to the nearby YMCA - super friendly staff and tons of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever bed and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: travel1028
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we'd been to San Francisco (but hopefully not the last) and we're glad we stayed here. The location along the bay is fab, the staff were friendly and our room was large, clean and comfy with a stunning view. San Francisco is amazing and did everything in 4 days. You must see the sealions at pier 39, go to alcatraz, have breakfast at Sears in union square (the most amazing pancakes) and go to all the different districts, ride a tram and walk the golden gate. And the food is amazing! didn't have one bad meal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: ESK57
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this hotel and I'm glad they did. it was small boutique hotel close to the waterfront and many restaurants. Rooms were large and well appointed. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can never get enough of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingworldnow
Reviews.Content: this is my second stay at the Vitale. the staff are kind, chatty and welcoming. We arranged everything including a meal at 'Spruce' through Keith the concierge before our stay. He was incredible as are many of the staff. Massages are great. we have stayed in a king overlooking the bridge and the circular suite, the bathrooms are wonderful with Japanese style seats and double showers in some. Get a room with a view of the Embacardo and go to Boulettes kitchen for breakfast. Clean smart, stylish and buzzy in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe by the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Picky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights as part of a mini "road trip". (See also Yosemite View Lodge and Carmel Mission Inn). Had a city deluxe room, large and airy, high quality furnishings, plasma TV, I pod docking staion and enormous comfy bed. Decent sized luxury bathroom with shower and (small) bath. There were even recycling facilities in the room, with one wastebin just for recycled items! All staff were friendly and helpful, and we made good use of the concierge for transport queries and other recommendations. The hotel is right next to the bay, on the edge of the financial district. 15 mins (mainly flat!) walk to Union Square. Start of cable car on Market St is just around the corner. Didn't eat at the hotel (or use the bar, which was always packed.) Only slight negatives were that although the room was on the 5th floor, it was noisy from very early (05.00 ish) in the morning, with road noise, trolley buses etc. Probably didn't wake me up, but made it difficult getting back to sleep. There was very limited cupboard / storage space in the room: no doubt loads of guests are just there for one or two nights, but I'm sure we weren't the first people to have stayed at the beginning of a 2 week trip, and wanting to unpack! Although a "turndown" service was mentioned , we didn't get this during our stay. We got a 3 day MUNI Pass (18$) which you can use on cable car, street cars, BART and the trolleybuses. This is great value as one journey on the cable car is $5 and on the buses etc $2. The Ferry building over the road is a gastronomic paradise, with loads of specialist food shops, some restaurants and farmers' markets 4 times a week. Ferry building recommendations: Boulette's Larder for breakfast, excellent burgers at Taylor's Automatic Refresher, good Mexican at Mijita, The Slanted Door - great Vietnamese food. NB Difficult to get in as usually fully booked, but get there at 5 ish and ask if there are any walk ins. (Managed to be first in the line the evening we went!) Mijita was good, but check out closing times! We got there just after 7 one evening,ordered starter and first margarita, went back 10 mins later for more margaritas and main course and the kitchen had closed with no warning given to punters this was about to happen! All in all enjoyed our stay there and would return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmama39
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The room itself was nice, nothing over the top.....very clean and very comfortable. (The linens and towels were top notch and the toiletries were nice). My only complaint was the light that came in the top of the blinds in the morning around 7:00. (We were traveling the first time in 2 years without our young children and were looking forward to sleeping in late). I was kicking myself for forgetting the eye shades. The location is wonderful. Each morning we walked across the street to the Ferry Building for a latte and some baked goods. We hit the Farmer's Market there on Saturday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil getaway in the city”
Reviews.Author: huibrela
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff at this peaceful oasis in the city. Stayed in the circular suite - amazing views and a bathtub in the room to enjoy them in. I love the location of this hotel. Go to the ferry building to wander around or take a ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view of the bay!”
Reviews.Author: moonshadow8705
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little pricey, but totally worth it! The view was lovely. The room was impeccable, spacious, modern and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I only wish we could have stayed more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Great local next to FerryBuilding”
Reviews.Author: Carpentermom
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love the Hotel Vitale. We love the FERRY BUILDING MARKETPLACE this hotel is steps away. Public transportation all around. Convenient from the stop on the Bart. Joie de vivre Hotel chain. One of the chains more pricey hotels. Spotless bathroom (but no place to put your clothes and a drain that did not drain) Comfortable beds with soft linens (carpet in sad need of a shampooing (441) Indifferent staff (sorry, but true) Did not tell us anything about the hotel when we checked in. No information in room on the Spa. $45 for valet overnight parking ouch!.(I know, I know, San Francisco) At 11am they would not even sell us a cup of coffee in the Americano. Lavender is the Hotel's signature scent and that is the nowhere on the description of the hotel. I am allergic to Lavender; Fortunately, I had CLARITON with me so I could breathe! We booked a room with no view because it was only available with two beds. Pet friendly(Did not have a pet with me) Our Joy of Life welcome gift was waiting for us(Hurrah) (With extra lavender which I quickly tossed out of the room) Would I stay there again? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: salgo
Reviews.Content: Only thing missing from the room was coffee. Complimentary coffee service is in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: mpkp
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel whose web site does not do its rooms justice. We were upgraded to a fantastic room facing the Bay Bridge. Much better location being near the Ferry Building than inland or near Fishermans wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigben782
Reviews.Content: The first thing that caught my eye about this hotel with that it was the same as my surname. We paid top dollar and stayed in the second best room available and were not dissapointed. The spectacular 180 degree view of the harbour and the amazing bed and views from the bath combined with every comfort imagineable. The service was exemplary, my girlfriend and I joked that the staff were ninjas because we never once noticed them yet every time we left the room and room was serviced and cleaned. The little things appeal too, such as a weather card each night, the fruit platter on arrival, free bottles of water and sweets at night. The hotel staff were more than happy to accommodate any request including DVDs, a umbrella for the rain, room service. This hotel is the best hotel I have stayed at from the many 5 star hotels abroad and Australia which I have visited. I would highly recommend it to anyone and I cannot wait to revisit San Francisco in order to stay at Hotel Vitale once more.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: scaramoosh
Reviews.Content: We walked in off the street, having unexpectedly checked out of the DREADFUL Clift Hotel and our spirits were low. We'd endured almost a week of being exploited by the Clift's overpriced and lazy pretentions, which pretty much ruined our trip to San Francisco. On the spur of the moment we brought our stay there to an abrupt end and decided to try out the Vitale which we'd passed by on our way to the wonderful Ferry Building. What a difference; world's apart. The staff practically bent over backwards to make us welcome and did their utmost to make sure we had everything we needed. The room was fabulous. Having suffered too long trying to negotiate a bathroom the size of a broom cupboard at the Clift, I hardly wanted to leave the luxury of the one at the Vitale - sheer indulgence. It cost us less to stay at the Vitale than the rip-off Clift, and I'm just sorry we didn't know then what we do now. The Vitale renewed our faith in San Francisco at a time where the Clift had all but destroyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent destination!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimmydes
Reviews.Content: This hotel rocks!!! Staff was ultra friendly, every amenity you could imagine in =cluding the private baths on the roof!! Very cool!! Room service was friendly and efficient, centrally located with great views...Can't go wrong....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tjibbs
Reviews.Content: I got a great expedia deal on this--under $200/night before tax. Stayed here for the San Francisco Marathon, which starts literally right outside the doors of the hotel. But there's a lot else right outside this hotel's doors--Ferry Building, Farmers Market, Whatever The Name of The Giants Stadium This Year...the entire Embarcadero is right there. Room was fantastic, even though the "city view" is little more than an office across the street. Needing an early night's sleep, silence was crucial to me and the construction of this place didn't let me down. The BEST aspect of this hotel, as you'll see from my photos, are the multiple outdoor sitting/drinking/dining terraces on all the higher levels. Great in the afternoon which tends to be sunny and warmer in this SF microclimate. The restaurant is above average, but certainly don't hesitate to go out to eat. Lot of great dining spots in SF. Finally, they may have the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered. Just outstanding service! I've stayed at half a dozen hotels in SF and this has been the best, hands down. I was always a Harbor Court fan, but this place has that beaten, and at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: Northeasttrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first destination from our Honeymoon. It sits right opposite the Embarcadero which is a lovely walk down to Pier 39. There are regular trams that run from right outside the hotel uptown and to the Castro and other areas. The hotel staff were exceptionally attentive, very accommodating - we got a bottle of Verve clique from the reception after they found out we were recently married. We have a view of the embarcadero from our room which was exceptionally comfortable and of high quality. The perfect destination/base for any visitor to San Fran

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GQ_Trippin
Reviews.Content: HOTEL. A beautiful and luxurious boutique hotel with a romantic ambiance. STAFF. Professional and welcoming. We were suppose to have a bottle of champagne delivered to our room and they forgot but was gracious enough to ship it to us. I don’t dock points for honest mistakes. ROOM. Small yet cozy. We had a great view of the waterfront and bay. SHOWER. Surprisingly nice and big. LOCATION. On the waterfront in Embarcadero. ATTRACTION. Directly across the Ferry building—great for a stroll on Saturday when there’s a Farmer’s market. TIP(S). Americano is an Italian restaurant. It’s good but San Francisco has so much more to offer. The waterfront alone has a few great name restaurants worth seeking out. Americano is however convenient if you don’t want to venture away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Special”
Reviews.Author: FrankiePalmDesert_CA
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a delightful stay. The hotel staff is exceptional in every way. They are gracious & knowledgeable. The maintenance and cleanliness of the hotel is exceptional. Of course, the location is the best in the city. You are to be commended on the success of making your guests feel welcome, safe, and eager to return to SF. Keep up the outstanding work.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Less Than Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mljc68
Reviews.Content: I can't think of a single thing I would change about Hotel Vitale. The staff is courteous and professional, the rooms are comfortable with so many nice amenities (the shower alone makes it worth it!) and it could not be in a better location. It's close to everything but it also feels quiet and remote when you need to get away from the crowds. The restaurant patio is awesome for late afternoon drinks and snacks. We wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Deleivered everything it promised”
Reviews.Author: dublinminx
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Vitale, and loved it. What I expected was a boutique upscale Hotel, and I got that and more. I payed for a queen bed internal view room, but signed up to the Hotels loyalty programme beforehand. The rates were great. I was pleasantly surprised to have a bay view room. It was very spacious, with full amenities of a 4* Hotel. The bathroom products are Aveda, so I'm not sure what the last poster got.I found the staff to be excellent. Yes there are lots of things you can pay extra for, in terms of mini bar, extras, room service etc. But its a consumer market. Don't buy if you don't like the prices. I found the staff to be excellent. Went out of their way to engage with you. A young female member of the bell staff was excellent, friendly, and really should be a concierge with her knowledge and manner with guests.The Hotel appears to get a lot of business clientelle, but there was no attitude with us who were far more casual.The bar is excellent, with great cocktails, and a very popular happy hour. We didn't eat at the hotel apart from some bar snacks which were decent. The general food prices didn't encourage me to try more, but there are so many other options. We also did'nt avail of the Spa services. The outdoor space is lovely overlooking the bay on a balmy summers evening. I also thought the location was excellent, providing a great base to explore San Fran. I would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Carpinteria_CASeanF
Reviews.Content: I can whole-heartedly give a rating of "excellent" for each of the catergories listed. We arrived at the hotel and were immediately made to feel welcome. The staff was efficient, professional and friendly. The door staff, bell staff, front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff greeted us like returning friends during our entire stay. I was impressed that the staff was able to give us such personalized attention even though the hotel was sold out and San Francisco was overflowing with visitors for Gay Pride Weekend Our room was designed with our comfort and tranquility in mind. I was impressed with the lighting throughout the hotel. It is obvious the designers gave much thought to the colors, fabrics and mood in the public and private spaces. After spending each day exploring San Francisco on foot, it was a pleasure to come back to our quiet, comfortable location with its scenic view of the Ferry Building and Bay Bridge. We visited the Spa and were impressed again by the tone and quality. It was relaxing just being in the space. I would recommend Hotel Vitale to anyone who wants to visit San Francisco and enjoy the comfort and elegance that is provided there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vitale: A Modern Fairytale”
Reviews.Author: lyncottee
Reviews.Content: After a long and fairly harrowing flight from Melbourne, Australia and being stranded in LAX for eight hours, just making it to any hotel would have been good enough for us. We just wanted to put our heads down and get on with our holiday. I wouldn't have thought it possible that after what we suffered we would actually be revived, revitalised and jumping out of our skin with delight, but that's what our welcome and four day stay at Hotel Vitale did for us. At any luxury hotel, you expect excellent decor, wonderful linen, a great bathroom and brilliant service. It's all there at Hotel Vitale, but we were also soothed, coccooned, pampered and uplifted by our whole experience. We especially loved our gorgeous, massive room overlooking the Bay Bridge and the friendly, well-mannered, highly efficient staff. All the little details, the ones that really matter to me, were just perfect. From the soothing sound generator by the bedside, to the excellent CDs provided in the room, no effort had been spared to make this a fairytale experience well beyond our expectations. A special mention of the concierge, Keith, the smoothest, most competent concierge I have ever met. What a great staff, what a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luxe333
Reviews.Content: Loved - would recemmend it to anyone visiting San Fran - we enjoyed the location across from the ferry terminal (which had great places to eat and explore)

Reviews.Title: “Snotty and Overpriced; arrogant staff”
Reviews.Author: oaklanddba
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Vitale 3 times. The usual decline in service and experience after the first year post-opening is happening here too. The aromatheraphy bath products that made the shower seem so luxurious in days gone by are no longer from Fresh Corp....they're now generic flavorless gels from some innofensive and unknown maker...clearly cutting costs. The port cochere where you enter the lobby is now home to 20 flies mating. I didn't enjoy waiting 10 minutes for the valet to get my car. But I really didn't enjoy listening to the remaining 2 valets (one of which seemed to be the lead) share stories about the hot girls they wanted to bed and showing each other pictures of these girls on their iPhones. There's a feeling like you'd better not touch anything in the room or else a charge would apply to your account....for instance, a personal oxygen can placed in the bathroom discreetly advises you that there will be a $16 charge. If you turn on the TV, you have to dig through the 7 major menu sections of pay content ($20 for a movie) before you can get out to the local news (last option on the menu) and I never did find CNN, MSNBC, or MTV...rooms don't seem to have full cable. And then there's the lovely matter of the small card folded discretely in the envelope with the extra room key which states that they are honored to charge your room account an extra dollar to support some local state funded/run park...unless you get down to the front desk and opt out of their scheme. Very sneaky, very tacky...and this on top of a nearly $300 per night rate. Felt very much like a poor person was nickle and diming me to death and that I should pay attention to every piece of written matter in my room lest I inadvertently miss a fee clause in my interaction with it and be levied a surcharge for not bringing my lawyer with me to protect me from the hotel's sad revenue generating sneakiness. This last bit with the $1 that you had to opt-out really ruined my sense that the hotel was a hospitality experience...felt like I was just there to be pumped. Also, don't get the Bay view rooms...they're mostly views of a building across the street and there's a 20-something's lounge on that whole side of the building whose music and drunken expense account partyers you can hear until 1AM. Vitale is located at one of the lowest elevations in San Fran...the sewer drains outside the building often smell of stale sewer. Unfortunately or coincidentally, my bathroom smelled of the same stale sewer, but this may have been a mold problem from the cutout in the glass shower wall intended for turning on the shower, which however also allows a good rain shower on the whole toilet by the end of your shower....go potty before you shower or you'll need to towel off again after using the toilet...which explains the funky smell in there. Oh, and $45 a night for parking.... Watch your back with these people...they'll try to charge for more things that you'd think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and very accommodating with my young kids”
Reviews.Author: nemacolin
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked in a room with one bed. I called their reservations department and explained I was travelling with 4 year old twins. The agent owned the situation and immediately upgraded me to a suite with curtains to seperate the sleeping areas. This is a semi-typical boutique, city, hip hotel. Not the place you would expect the staff to want to deal with 4 year old twins. Everyone there could not have been better. Arrival was good, door staff and front desk were very friendly and accommodating. Room was great. Room service was good throughout our stay. I requested my coffee and breakfast at 5:45 am each day (an hour before listed times) and they had no problem filling that request. They have seating and lounge type areas on all the roofs and they are spectacular. The furniture is showing some signs of fatigue but the setting and views make up for that. Good location in SF for kids as well. The trolley loops all start directly behind the hotel. You can take the trolley to the Wharf or up California and connect with North Beach, etc...very convenient. Parking is a block or two away but that is expected with the location. Overall, fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: DH1234
Reviews.Content: Was there to see a Giants game at AT&T park. Arrived early and they honored our package, which included valet parking, even before we got the room. This is a very modern hotel with modern decor. Staff is very friendly and helpful with everything. The location is superb with easy walking distance to everything on the Embarcadaro. (Ferry Bldg, ATT Park, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Primo San Francisco Location”
Reviews.Author: BlondeandBlue99
Reviews.Content: To provide a little background - I live in the San Francisco Bay Area and work four blocks from this hotel. It would be fair to say I know the area very well. I stayed at the Vitale a couple of times three years ago, once in an "inner courtyard" room (not so great) and once in a Superior King room overlooking the Embarcadero and bay (very nice). Happened to hit on an unbelieveable rate one day for the Panoramic Suite - nearly 40% off. The Panoramic Suite I would call "the round room". These rooms are on the corner of the hotel overlooking Embarcadero and the Bay Bridge, with the infamous bathtub in the bedroom itself. First off, I don't know how you can beat this location while visiting San Francisco unless you are big into shopping and the theater, in which case a room in the Union Square area would be better. The Vitale is right on Embarcadero, and about 1/4 of a block from the Ferry Building which is sort of our local temple of foodie worship. On Saturdays there is a large Farmer's Market as well. A room on the "water" side of the hotel makes for some pretty great people watching up and down Embarcadero. No television required. First the good - the room is large, spacious, with very tall ceilings and beautiful picture windows. One would not feel cramped here even after a four or five day stay. The bed is soft and very comfortable - linens luscious. The bathtub in the room, while a very simple tub without the fancy jets etc., is to DIE FOR. I walk by the Vitale all the time and wondered about the privacy issue and when you're up in the room looking out you realize .... no one's looking up from the street! No one cares - they are busy admiring the view of the bay. Once I got in the tub, I followed suit. As noted here in other reviews, shower in the bath is an overhead rainfall type with simple and clean partial glass enclosure. Very classy. Room service - blindingly fast. Breakfast arrived in under 15 minutes. Now the negatives. The noise from the street is pretty intense. Unless you're from NYC or live in the city, this might get to you after a while. This is NOT a quiet and peaceful location. Expect bus and intersection noise to be a factor as early as 6:00 a.m. There was no in room coffee, and I had to call room service for two wine glasses. The toilet was one of the water saver models and simply didn't work. I would stay at the Vitale again but next time would opt for a city view room or there's a side of the hotel that overlooks a small park. The Panoramic Suite is very pretty and almost warrants a room rate most of us think twice about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location, service, views - just fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mooseloose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and the service did not falter once. We upgraded our original internal view booking (made via Expedia) for a water view and enjoyed fantastic views of the Bay Bridge, Ferry Building and Treasure Island. The room was very clean and spacious, the bathroom had a large "rain" shower and the bed linens, especially the pillows were devine. The staff were were nice and cheerful, the restaurant was also pretty good - it took advantage of the two Farmer's Market days over the road at the ferry building (Tuesdays and Saturday's) extending a special dish on those evenings. The bar seemed to be the place to go throughout the week so it could get noisy (Saturday and Sunday were much quieter) but the double glazed windows in the room blocked out most of the noise so we didn't find it a problem. If you don't have a room with a view you can easily get up to the hotel rooftop, to admire the sunrise and sunsets or even take a picnic. The hotel has a free yoga class in the morning and a small gym but guests also enjoy free access to the YMCA just a 2 minute walk away. Rooms had free internet provision (wireless and cable), a safe, minibar and very nice toiletries. Possibly the only thing to be aware of is that there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room (I had a travel kettle with me so it wasn't a problem). I think it would be hard to beat this hotel. I'm giving it 10 out of 10 !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David072
Reviews.Content: This place is expensive, but awesome. Our room had a view of the bay, & the ferry building. The modern decor looked like something out of a magazine. If I had enough money I would stay here every time I am in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Dan1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the 180 degree Panoramic suites on the last night of our Honeymoon and it was the perfect finish. The view was amazing taking in most of the bay from the Bay Bridge past The Ferry Building and almost to Alcatraz. The only problem was that the Embarcadero was quite noisy. We live in London so were used to it but it might disturb some people. Service was great and the Valet and Bellboys did not appear to expect to be tipped for every little thing they did which was a welcome change. The bar looked very cool but we arrived at about 1800 on a Friday night so it was packed with local office workers. My wife really enjoyed the free hour of yoga in the morning. I would definitely recommend splashing out on the Panoramic suite. Bobby Tang (reservationist) was particularly helpful in booking the room. As other reviewers have said join the JDV club for points, discounts and upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel but....................”
Reviews.Author: kathrynyc
Reviews.Content: You have no idea where they are putting you- We have stayed at the Vitale before. This stay I called reservations directly. I knew exactly the room type I wanted and was willing to pay the extra $$$. The rooms in the hotel make a big difference to the quality of your stay. I was told we would be on 6-8th floor with water view. Got to hotel and told there is no such quarentee and was given a room on 3 with view a patch of water and wall. Went back said i would rather have a room like we prior stayed in- city view and was given the choice of the same room we had before- I was told they would adjust price- well when we got to check out after a 4 day stay my city view room and deluxe water view reservation came to a difference of 9 dollars a night- I overheard many problems at the front desk while sitting in the lobby. One couple I talked to said the front desk told them they shouldn't book thru the hotel but expedia or some other service. I was totally confused checking in and checking out. Maybe that is how they break you down to spend top dollar for whatever room you finally wind up with. Its too bad since the hotel is lovely- great location. Beware coming off the elevator at restaurant's happy hour time- the noise coming from the bar sounds like a wind tunnel!!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: ArsLongaVitaBrevis
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel, with an unbeatable location right on the Embarcadero. Our room had a view of the Bay Bridge, Ferry Island, and Treasure Island, and on the 7th floor was very quiet. (The bar is a noisy scene, so I'd recommend getting a room away from that and as far up as you can) The concierge and front desk staff are very helpful, the appointments in the rooms are outstanding, and the large bathrooms with walk in shower and overhead "rain" showerhead are great. This is the first hotel I remember that had a small sauna bench in the shower, and another one by the mirror to use the dressing table. The restaurant is good although pricey for what you get. I found that room service food had too big a quantity - we could easily share a breakfast entree. You should be able to negotiate a bit on price, although it is expensive. But worth it!

Reviews.Title: “My new Favorite....”
Reviews.Author: moltini3
Reviews.Content: It was perfect from start to finish. We checked in and we were offered a warm towel to wash the travel off - I loved it! The staff was sincere and very professional. Couldn't have been nicer. Front desk, conceirge, restaurant personel, bell captains, housekeeping etc. We and two other couples were impressed. In fact one couple we were with came back the following weekend. Perfect location and a great expirence. Hotel Vitale is our new favorite. We will be back! Thank you Vitale...

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycyogagirl
Reviews.Content: I used to live in SF and know that the bar at Hotel Vitale rocks! That said, the rooms do not rock. The cityview rooms are small and I saw a bunch of them.... since the first room I got was a floor above the valet parking and you could hear the bar and the parking lot. I was showed three other rooms and they were all small. Finally, the room service was not impressive. A $30 chicken breast was tiny and I got 5 vegetables when I ordered a side of veggies. Good location, bar, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Basically, very goo.”
Reviews.Author: dancingnancy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vitale, San Franciso 12/31/08-1/5/09 It was a real treat to spend 5 nights at Hotel Vitale. The location was delightful: on The Embarcadero, opposite The Ferry Building, a couple of blocks from the California St. cable car and a 15 minute walk to Union Square, There were also many fine restaurants we could walk to in addition to Americano, the excellent restaurant in the hotel. The room we had was a notch or two larger than I expected. The décor was very boutique-hotel, with restful pale blue added to the usual beiges and browns. A long wooden unit contained generous desk space, the mini bar, some storage and an extensive selection of snacks, candies etc. for sale. (I always immediately put these in a drawer or the closet shelf. I don’t like the clutter or the temptation.) A chaise longue near the window was a great place to watch the constant traffic of ships gliding under the Bay Bridge just outside. The bathroom was rather lame for such a deluxe hotel…Painted sheetrock wall, a nondescript (well, it was squarish) counter sink, not great lighting. Actually it wasn’t deluxe at all. I had major internet issues that could not be fixed even after long conversations with the tech crew in Georgia. If good internet connection is important to you, sign up for the costly premium connection when you first arrive. It was impossible for me to switch once I had signed up for five days. Definitely a flaw. If it had been a working trip, I probably would have had to go to another hotel. Joie de Vivre should offer acceptable free internet service…Or not bother with free service. That said, the staff did their best. We had a note and wine and lots of sympathy from the front desk crew. It’s a wonderful hotel that I can enthusiastically recommend with that one craveat.

Reviews.Title: “So Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: HartsAbound
Reviews.Content: We checked in for the weekend and loved every minute. Fantastic location, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “We like Vitale a lot”
Reviews.Author: RobertAdes
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Hotel Vitale. I'll give you a quick summary. First, we booked the week of our stay, requesting a Deluxe City View, which is one step up from a standard room. Since we contacted the hotel directly by phone, we expressed our concerns about noise and they honored that request with a higher-up room facing south (which meant that we had a partial Bay View and could see some of the bridge). The rate was heavily discounted because of the season. After booking, we found a better rate on travelzoo.com and the hotel honored it. The front desk staff, both at check in, and the concierge, are totally on top of their game. At check in the manager on duty who handled our check-in noted our request for a quiet room and gave us the best thing he had, and we were pleased. During our stay, the concierge gave us great advice on nearly restaurants. The housekeeping service pays attention to small details. For example, we brought some bottled water, and they took the extra effort to put it on ice for us. The hotel is clean, modern and updated. It offers free wi-fi in the rooms (at a slower bit rate; faster datastreams cost $10). I'd say it's nicer than a W, but hip in a similar vein. There are multiple roof-top patios with great views -- don't miss them. Things to note: Request a higher floor to avoid noise. Bay View rooms are noisier due to the Embarcadero. City View Rooms don't have much view. Best option is to request north or south facing rooms. The bar is loud and very "happening". Don't expect a lot of big hotel amenities --- the gym is small, there is no pool, and there is no cafe (although there is a restaurant, and plenty of food at the Ferry Building across the street.) Parking is really tough in the area. The hotel charges $45 + tax, but you can find nearby garages for less (we kept our car at the Rincon Center a block away). Remember, parking meters start at 7am-6pm, M-Sat. Sunday is free. The Ferry Building across the street has lots to see and eat, but can be overwhelming on Saturdays. Still, it's worth spending time there. If you want to go to the Slanted Door (a hot, pan-Asian restaurant), book ahead. All in all, I'd highly recommend Hotel Vitale. -Robert

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at Hotel Vitale”
Reviews.Author: ShawnConna
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference in San Francisco and tried to stay at the hotel where the conference was being held. On the day before the conference, the other hotel raised their rates almost $80, so I looked around for a better deal and a nicer hotel. i found both at the Hotel Vitale. While usually more expensive than I care to spend, Hotel Vitale offers discounts for last minute reservations and for local Bay Area residents. The staff were amazing friendly and helpful and the facilities were spectacular in their cleanliness and tasteful amenities. The outdoor terraces are beautiful, especially at night and even in the rain. My room was quiet, although I was awoken at about 5 in the morning by a garbage truck picking up recycling on the street below. I've stayed i many hotels in SF for business, so this is not an unusual occurrence in my experience. If I can afford it or find a special deal, I'll definitely stay at the Hotel Vitale again!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: folly111
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! We came over from the East Bay for a wedding and get away weekend. We lucked into unusually warm fall weather and we were upgraded to one of the corner rooms with wrap around window view of San Francisco Bay and the Bay Bridge. Does it get any better? The room and staff were great and the views were spectacular. Great location for walking along the Embarcadero and lunch outside along the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsC08
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop of our honeymoon and we wished we could have stayed longer. The hotel is set on one of the main streets near to the Bay Bridge and also next to the bay. The staff were very friendly and professional upon our arrival and soon had us settled in our room. This was located on the second flor over the entrance with the view of the main street and the bay bridge. We personally loved this and didn't experience any noise or problems. The room was small but comfortable, with every available amenity and luxurious bedding. There was an internet room available right near our room which was great to keep in contact with friends and family. We did not eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the food. However, there is a fab place opposite called the Boulevard, very expensive but the food is of excellent quality. Our only criticism of the hotel was that out of all the hotels we stopped in on our honeymoon, this was the most expensive and didn't make us feel special. As mentioned in other reviews, we received some kind of gift at other places i.e. wine but not in this hotel. Other than the above, the hotel is a great place to stop, right near the main front and not far from pier 39!

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: kathieann
Reviews.Content: Our 7 night stay at the Vitale was wonderful from start to finish. We had a deluxe bay front room on the 7th floor which was lovely. The view from the wall-to-wall window of the bay bridge was awesome. All off the staff were wonderful and accommodating, including the front desk, the concierge, bellmen and especially housekeeping. Our rooms were always cleaned as soon as we left in the morning. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant twice which we enjoyed. Boulettes Larder in the Ferry Building across the street served a great breakfast. (don't miss it) The hotel's lounge and outdoor bar/patio was open late and got very crowded. Despite this we never had any problem with noise. The hotel was in a great location away from all the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf. If we were to return to SF, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean, great location BUT VERY NOISY ROOMS!!!”
Reviews.Author: wowclaire
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay at hotels this nice, but my business paid for it. The rooms are nice and feature a lot of extras, like free shoe polishing, water bottle, a little card with the next day's temperature, etc. The room was clean and I wasn't afraid to walk around with bare feet or touch the bedspread. However, the one major fault I have with this hotel was its noise. I have stayed on both the 5th and 7th floors, bay view rooms, and have been able to hear the following: the elevator doors opening and closing, the maid's closet door opening and closing numerous times, music and talking from other rooms, and cars honking outside. The view from the room is magnificent and its location can't be beat. I've run along the Embarcadero each morning and all you have to do is cross the street. The staff is excellent and will find a taxi for you anytime, but I just couldn't get over how loud my room was for the price my firm paid.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling fresh and new.”
Reviews.Author: Photopedia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Vitale for three nights when I was in town for a convention at the Moscone Center which is a brisk 20 minute walk up Mission Street. The hotel was only built 3 1/2 years ago and it is still looking fresh and new. I liked the location next to the Oakland Bay Bridge and the Embarcadero. In my view its preferable to a hotel right in the city center. In any case, you can catch a cab to just about anywhere in 5 - 10 minutes. I loved the modern decor of the lobby, bar and bedrooms which are all spacious and bright. The hotel is low rise so you don't have to wait any time for the elevators. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. A couple of minor gripes. The service at breakfast was sluggish and I could have done with a coffee maker in my bedroom although room service did offer to bring one up to me. All in all I'd be very happy to return to the Vitale and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Who gets the good rooms?”
Reviews.Author: PinotSeller
Reviews.Content: Traveling to San Francisco a few times a year for business, we are still trying to find the right hotel. This was our second try for Hotel Vitale, and we are not sure whether we'll give it another. We were arriving in SF from overseas, and requested a quiet room. Our flight was 8 hours late, so we arrived exhausted. At the front desk we asked if the room was quiet, and was assured that it was. Well, when we opened the door to the room, we were assalted by the bass from the bar downstairs...not even close to quiet. We called downstairs and they showed us a room in the back corner, where it was quiet, but dirty, broken closet doors. The third room we were shown was right on Mission street, and the valet assured us that it would be quite noisy in the morning. Choosing sleep, we opted for the quiet room. The next morning we asked for a better room and for $60 extra (making the room charge over $400) we were moved to a room on a higher floor, remarkably cleaner and with a great view of the Bay. Our take on this hotel is that if you pay the big dollars, the rooms are quiet and clean. If you choose a more inexpensive room, expect it to be noisy and not as clean as you would like it to be. San Francisco is very expensive, but there has to be a hotel where if you pay $300/night, you can expect a clean room and a good nights sleep. Unfortunately, Hotel Vitale is not it. The positives for this hotel are its location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem perfectly located with awesome views”
Reviews.Author: kelpunk
Reviews.Content: In celebrating my husband's birthday, we wanted a quiet get-away weekend while checking out the Fleet Week in San Francisco. Great little modern boutique hotel situated perfectly right across the Embarcadero building and awesome eateries everywhere including the hotel's own Americano. After taking the night time Alcatrez tour getting back to the hotel past 10pm - we were famished and ordered the short ribs and "mac n cheese" which were "to die for" comfort food. When we got back to the hotel, they surprised us with two cupcakes and a happy birthday wish - which really made me look good - since I was rushed to plan the weekend and didn't think about some of the details. We ended the weekend with messages in their spa - which capable masseuse made up for the somewhat surprising small facility. Combined with beautiful weather, and gorgeous views - I'd recommend staying at this little gem on your next stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: DDtwo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other JDV hotels which is one reason I picked Hotel Vitale. We completed the last days of our Honeymoon in San Francisco and decided to try Vitale due to their location and their excellent reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed in any way. Megan was great in making our reservations and noting it was our Honeymoon. First off, our room was upgraded to waterfront view. Since it was not ready on arrival, Daniel offered us drinks in Americano's bar. We had two drinks each which the hotel picked up. We were then shown to our room which had an amazing view of the East Bay bridge. Off we went for dinner and upon our return, Champagne and chocolates were left at our bedside. Romantic is the only word I can think of due to the soft music and low lights left on for us. It was a little noisy due to the bar downstairs, but we just kept the soft music on until the bar closed. The noise was not something you could really hear unless you focused on it. We slept VERY soundly during our stay there, yes the beds are perfect too. There was a running race I decided to run Sunday morning and again, they help to direct me to the place to sign up and gave me some bandaids prior to my run. Little things that convey their committment to customer service. We didn't try Americano only because we have our favorite places to eat in SF. We loved our stay at this hotel that modestly claims to be a three star hotel. It was a perfect stay and we plan on staying here many more times.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: lianelau
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to San Francisco and this is my favorite place to stay. They do everything right here, from the service at the front door to the amendities. I appreciate getting the New York Times, Fresh products and a gym pass to the YMCA down the block. Also, I love the short walk to the Ferry Building.

Reviews.Title: “What a view from the room !”
Reviews.Author: Alvin&Tracy
Reviews.Content: This is third visit to San Francisco and this time, we actively took the decision to stay in a completely different areas and get off the beaten track a little bit and not stay near Union Square (2 years ago we stayed at The Clift). The views from the room was the reason we booked this hotel. Well we did splash out and get bay bridge room and it was worth it - it was a suite and the view from the room was fantastic. Would definitely recommend this hotel and if you can stretch to the bat bridge room, you wont regret it and it is well worth every penny !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vitale”
Reviews.Author: richs10
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, NEW!!. We were in a basic room with 2 beds, a chair and a nice view of the Ferry Building. The room was not large, but was adequate and well designed. Bath was very nice. Good showerhead. Wonderful bath amenities. Loved the soaps and shampoo. The brand was "Fresh". The bed was TDF (to die for). This had to be one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. Very nice sheets, lots of pillows. Very restful sleep. One negative: The Vitale seems to be following the current hotel craze in giving you a flatscreen HDTV, but then having no HD programming. That was very irritating. The staff was very nice and accomodating. As we were leaving, we were attempting to severely overpack a rented SUV. The bellmen were extremely helpful in jockeying/jamming all our stuff and our bodies in the vehicle. At that point, I think they were glad to see us go! Finally, the location of the Vitale is EXCELLENT! Hotel Vitale: THUMBS UP!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Terrible Internet Policy”
Reviews.Author: theresama40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a pleasant weekend at the Hotel Vitale in May. What we liked: 1. Fabulous location on Embarcadero across from the Ferry Building 2. Amazing (and underused) roof deck with views onto the Bay 3. Comfortable rooms. We had one of the oddly shaped Urban Studio rooms (they're concave, believe it or not), which was good value for the size. The spacious bath area was particularly appreciated. 4. Wonderful toiletries from Fresh cosmetics What we didn't like: 1. Their Internet policy. Yes, wireless Internet was free, but that was only the lower speed wireless Internet. Higher speed Internet involved a charge. I thought this was misleading and hope that other hotels do not follow this horrible example. If it weren't for this, I would have awarded the Vitale five stars. 2. The decor. The beige and ice blue color scheme was soothing, but had something of the feel of a chain hotel. And did the room art come from a yard sale? Or was it high end art pretending to come from a yard sale? Too complicated for me. . .

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view; wonderful concierge”
Reviews.Author: lovetofly7
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Hotel Vitale after 27 hours in transit was a seamless entry into a serene world of pampering luxury. The circular suite on the sixth floor provided sweeping views of the Bay Bridge, while the room itself was tastefully appointed with comfortable furnishings and luxe Fresh bath products. Vitale's location is excellent for the pedestrian guest. The adjacent Ferry Building boasts a Saturday morning farmers' market that is second to none, and the heart of downtown is within easy walking distance. Perhaps best of all was the incredibly personable concierge, Jackie, who assisted with reservations at outstanding restaurants across the city and ensured that all five nights spent at her property were memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicvic4
Reviews.Content: Not as wonderful as we had hoped. Waterfront view was gorgeous but only through a small window; the staff was gracious and helpful. But the bar scene was noisy every night-- well into the night-- rendering the bar and the lobby useless and keeping us awake in our 6th floor room. The spa was tiny and the outdoor tubs were depressing- with no view and set in a corner of the roof. Room service was slow and expensive. So- we enjoyed our stay but were disappointed in the hotel. Definitely not the restful getaway we were anticipating.

Reviews.Title: “loved the vitale”
Reviews.Author: FBinUK
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel - though the bar is very popular and loud in the evening although they're the 'after work crew' and disapear by 9.30pm. Very helpful staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Staff not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mandarinlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Vitale for two nights, weekend in July '08. We were in town for a family event. The hotel is beautiful, with modern chic decor, very enjoyable. The check-in process was quick, though unfriendly. The reception lady said the hotel is fully booked and did not offer a selection of floor or bed type. I was given a room on the second floor, right above the hotel entrance which was extremely loud. When I called to complain they wanted $20/night extra to move me to a quieter room which faces the inner yard. The new room was exactly the same (actually a bit smaller), only two floors up. I guess you have to pay for peace and quiet nowadays. Aside from that, the room was great with all the amenities (too bad about no HDTV) and wonderful shower/water pressure. The hotel has two terraces that overlook the bay bridge which are amazing. Overall, great hotel, would come back despite the poor treatment by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Ruby49
Reviews.Content: We drove from Santa Barbara to the Hotel, very easy to get location. Turned the car over to Valet and enjoyed the city. The staff were very helpful from the curb to the room. We had room # 614 great view of the water & the bridge. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Big bathroom w/ walk-in shower, lots of towels and my favorite, a dimmer on one of the lights. Very good food and fast for room service, great coffee in the morning only 5-10 mins. Breakfast was also very quick & fresh. The terrace on the roof is a wonderful place to get away. Would stay here again in a minute! Only problem was wi-fi on my iPhone was very painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AMBUWS29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Vitale for the second time for a business trip. The front desk was very helpful. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are aesthetically very pleasing. I also got a massage in the hotel's spa. Initially we were disappointed because the hotel doesn't offer services like manicures and pedicures, but the massage I got from Jimmy quickly made up for all of that. He did an excellent job, using totally different techniques. I still feel relaxed days later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kecoleman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We felt like royalty. The staff attends to your every need - whatever paper you want, whatever temperature you like... We had a great view of the bay bridge and could walk to Chinatown, the Embarcadero, Union Square and cable cars. It is a longer walk or a quick bus ride to Fishermans Wharf but that was fine with us since it was so crowded. We had better restaurants near us including the hotel restaurant. I thought this type of personalized attention only came in $1000 a night rooms. makes for a very special visit.

Reviews.Title: “contemporary and stylish”
Reviews.Author: davis22
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Vitale and will certainly not be the last. The hotel enjoys an excellent location across from the ferry building. Public transportation is easily accessible whether by streetcar (which travels along market as well as to fisherman's wharf), buses, cable cars, BART and the muni. We use BART from the airport and are dropped off 2 blocks from the hotel. The rooms are contemporary and comfortably furnished. We have stayed in both a waterfront room as well as the urban studio room. The spa is compact but features excellent therapists. We used the hotel restaurant only for breakfast which was efficient and delicious. We typically dine at Boulevard (located across the street) and Slanted Door which is located in the Ferry building. San Francisco is a city of neighborhoods and in picking a hotel, you must decide on a surrounding ambience whether it is by the water (which we like), high up on one the hills, in the middle of shopping like union square or in a more residential area like the marina district. Overall our stays at the Vitale have been relaxing and enjoyable and we certainly plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vitale -- very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jbirkSf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I periodically stay in SF and have really enjoyed the Vitale. The location is excellent -- right on the water next to the Bay bridge. What's more on Saturday's you are then right across the street from the fantastic farmer's market -- you can cruise through and get a great and quick breakfast from one of the vendors with some really great coffee. Meanwhile, the hotel is set up in sort of a green, spa sort of vibe. Muted colors and soothing settings all over. Be sure to try the soak tubs on the roof, as well as the view rooms looking right at the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mini_MouseUk
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel. Very trendy and friendly! Great location, it is worth going to the 7th floor and onto the terrace for the view of the Oakland Bridge. Be warned, on a weekend the bar is very popular with the locals and gets very busy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Hotel Vitale”
Reviews.Author: Lk2Trvl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the hotel to celebrate her birthday. Celebration also included the treatment at the hotel spa and dinner at a hotel recommended restaurant. I chose the hotel primarily because of the great reviews it had received here at TripAdvisor. The room was great. We were upgraded at check in so the room had great view of the water. The bathroom as well stock with excellent toiletries and the oxygen can was an interesting touch. Room had a nice HDTV, although the TV would benefit from HD signal. Hotel staff was polite but not particularly friendly. I’d have been nice to get a smile. The check-in process didn’t go smoothly as we were given the wrong key, so we had to head back to the front desk. We were late for the spa so ended up getting charged for the full process for half the treatment time. Which is fine but I would have preferred it if they had explained this as oppose to just presenting the bill. Better communication would help here. The concierge recommended the Asian fusion restaurant which was very disappointing. Drinks were undrinkable, my napkin and silverware were dirty. During checkout we didn’t even receive a farewell. I had written an extensive feedback to the hotel on how they could improve but they never acknowledged it. Again, our overall experience was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnotherUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: This place is somewhat of a hidden gem - or at least that's the impression I got. It's in all the guide books etc but just appears totally unfussy and just what you need in SF; relaxing, friendly, comfy. The location gets some stick but I think it's perfect. Firstly, getting there from the airport is so easy. You can of course take a cab but I would advise anyone travelling light or in a small group to take the BART from the Intl Airport to Embarcedaro station (then just 5mins walk down the hill). It's a fraction of the cost and takes just as long as a taxi. It's also at the far end of the Embarcadero from Fisherman's Wharf - meaning there is amazing walk along the bay (passed some great sites: Coit Tower and the Alcatraz departure quay) to the tourist hell (but a must!) that is FW. It's also smack across the street from the Ferry Building. This is a gem - worth getting up early (courtesy of jetlag) and wondering over to for coffee from Peets - while watching the commuters come of the ferries. That has to be one the single most enjoyable things to do. The Ferry Building also has some the best restaurants in the area (Taylors/Slanted Door) and of course the actual ferries to Tiburon etc. The hotel is at the bottom of the hill from SF proper (think Union Square, shops etc) but this is easy to solve via the cable car, street cars or a healthy walk up the hill (20mins?). So the actual hotel...is great. The rooms as large, super clean, soothing and quiet. There is some fuss made over the city and bay views. But to be honest how much time are you spending looking out of the window? We had a city view room - which actually meant staring at an empty office block. But if you want a view - they've got it. The bed was astonishingly comfy. The bathroom was stocked with Fresh toiletries which will forever evoke memories of SF. The only issue was with the bathroom door. A slider, with poor closure. So depending on who you are travelling with.....you may want to run the taps.... The facilities aren't extensive, but just enough to sort on-line check in (business centre) and run a few miles (gym) - but shouldn't you be walking everywhere?
